p.b: Dots and other hieratic signs without hieroglyphic equivalents

conbody.p: Some hieratic signs like lines or dots which do not have hieroglyphic equivalents are available in the Ff group. For instance the dot (not verse point "O" or "o") is rendered by JSesh Code Ff110.
A cartouche is to be entered with "<-...->", e.g.: <-G7->.
A serekh is to be entered with "<S-...->", e.g.: <S-G7->. (S=Serekh).
A sign in a rectangular enclosure is to be entered with "<H-...->", e.g.: <H-R8->. (H=Ḥw.t).
NOTE: For some ḥw.t-signs there are Gardiner codes available in group O. Use these if applicable.

Haplographies are normally encoded where they first appear in the text. When they should appear again, encode them in double angle brackets: [&-[&- + Hieroglyph + -&]-&]. E.g. in this case the sign X8 should be written twice, so it needs to be inserted into double angle brackets in the position where it should appear for the second time: M23-X1 R4 X8 [&-[&-X8-&]-&] E15 R4.
